news_articles.title: Cocoa Prices are Falling. When Will Chocolate Get Cheaper?
news_articles.content: Cocoa prices have dropped from their 2024 peak — but don't expect chocolate bargains this holiday season. When will prices finally fall? Harry Black explains. (Source: Bloomberg)

news_articles.title: Cocoa Prices Are Plunging. Why Is Chocolate Still So Expensive?
news_articles.content: After last year’s historic rally, cocoa prices are heading for a record annual slump. But there’s no sign the cost of your candies, bars or chocolate Santas will follow any time soon.

news_articles.title: Modi Fast-Tracks Reforms to Shield Economy From US Tariffs
news_articles.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government pushed through far-reaching policy reforms in the final parliamentary session of the year, seeking to bolster the economy in the face of trade headwinds.

news_articles.title: China’s Rare-Earth Magnet Exports to US Decline in November
news_articles.content: China’s exports of rare-earth magnets to the US fell 11% in November from a month earlier, with no immediate rebound seen after a trade truce between the world’s two biggest economies.

news_articles.title: Colombia Readies Decree to Force Pensions to Invest More Locally
news_articles.content: Colombia plans to publish next year a decree that would force pension funds to invest more money in the local economy, according to a government website.

news_articles.title: Record $350 Billion Deals Boom Fuels Upbeat M&A Outlook in Japan
news_articles.content: It’s been a record year for deals involving Japanese companies, with transaction volume approaching $350 billion as December draws to a close. And next year is poised to be even busier.

news_articles.title: Why This Bull Market Isn't All About Tech
news_articles.content: Ryan Detrick, Chief Market Strategist at Carson Group, offers his analysis of the stock market's recent performance and explains why he disagrees with the notion that investors are overly focused on mega-cap tech stocks. Ryan joins Carol Massar, Tim Stenovec, and Bloomberg Chartered Market Technician Bill Maloney on Bloomberg Businessweek Daily. (Source: Bloomberg)

news_articles.title: Stocks Climb as Options Expiry Approaches $7.1 Trillion | The Close 12/19/2025
news_articles.content: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Robinhood Markets’ Stephanie Guild, CHANGE Global’s Thea Jamison, D Cowen’s Tom Fitzgerald, Navan’s Amy Butte, DWS Group’s David Bianco, Teneo’s Paul Keary, Counter’s Gregg Renfrew. (Source: Bloomberg)

news_articles.title: New Fortress Energy’s Delinquent Payments Mount Amid Debt Talks
news_articles.content: New Fortress Energy said Friday that it struck new forbearance agreements with holders of its term loans after failing to make interest payments and informing the lenders that it didn’t plan to make principal payments due at year-end.

news_articles.title: Inside Disney and OpenAI’s Billion Dollar Deal
news_articles.content: Today on the Big Take: Why Disney cut a deal with OpenAI after decades of safeguarding its intellectual property, what it stands to gain — and why now.

news_articles.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
news_articles.content: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia was down 16%.

news_articles.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
news_articles.content: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

news_articles.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
news_articles.content: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

news_articles.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
news_articles.content: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

news_articles.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
news_articles.content: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on Colombia.

news_articles.title: Swiss franc, Japanese yen Rise as DeepSeek News Boosts Safe Havens
news_articles.content: The Yen and Swiss Franc were stronger against the dollar as investors sought safe havens after Chinese start-up DeepSeek’s new AI model hit U.S. tech stocks.

news_articles.title: Natural Gas Falls on Shifting Weather Forecasts
news_articles.content: U.S. natural gas futures fell after weekend updates took some of the chill out of early February weather forecasts.

news_articles.title: Building-Products Distributor QXO Launches Hostile Bid for Beacon
news_articles.content: QXO is taking its offer directly to shareholders after being rebuffed on several occasions.

news_articles.title: Natural-Gas Firm Diversified Energy Strikes Deal for Permian Basin Player
news_articles.content: Maverick Natural Resources has operations in Texas and Oklahoma.

news_articles.title: What's New This Tax Season That Can Save You Money
news_articles.content: There are some new wrinkles, especially for those who sell things online or bought an EV.
